article.description: Dominic James had 17 points and six assists to help Marquette (No. 17 ESPN/USA Today, No. 16 AP) beat Eastern Michigan 95-62 on Saturday.
article.headline: No. 17 Marquette 4-0 after win over Eastern Michigan
article.linkText: Marquette 4-0 after easily defeating Eastern Michigan
article.story: MILWAUKEE (AP) -- Marquette overwhelmed Eastern Michigan with another impressive display of long-distance shooting. Dominic James scored 17 points and the Golden Eagles (No. 17 ESPN/USA Today, No. 16 AP) made 13 of 27 3-pointers in a 95-62 win Saturday. Wesley Matthews added 15 points and James also had six assists for Marquette (4-0), which went 10-for-19 from beyond the arc in an 87-45 victory over Detroit on Tuesday. "We moved the ball well," Marquette coach Tom Crean said. "A lot of guys were in the action and a lot of guys did good things." Devon Dumes led Eastern Michigan with 16 points. Marquette, which missed its first eight 3-point attempts, closed the first half by hitting 5-of-6 from behind the arc to build a 44-32 lead. The Golden Eagles, who didn't score until Jerel McNeal's baseline drive and dunk with 15:44 left in the first half, put together a 7-0 run to erase an early four-point deficit. James fed Matthews for a dunk and Ousmane Barro for a layup during the surge. Eastern Michigan (1-3) closed to 16-15, but Marquette responded with an 11-0 spurt. Marquette forced 26 Eastern Michigan turnovers, which translated into 32 points. The Golden Eagles finished with 11 blocked shots and 14 steals. "That's been the focus for us," McNeal said of the team's defense. "Coach said we have to get up and pressure guys and try to force turnovers." The Golden Eagles continued their hot 3-point shooting early in the second half. James and Matthews each converted 3s as Marquette's lead grew to 55-37. "It's a matter of time before guys start hitting shots," James said. "We were out of sync and rhythm. Once we forced turnovers, we started making shots." Lazar Hayward scored 13 points and Dan Fitzgerald had 12 for the Golden Eagles, who led by as many as 35. "We did it with our defense," Crean said. "We settled in and pressured the ball well. We got better as the game went on."

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
